title: How to Measure Chair Covers

steps.headline: Identify what chairs you want to wrap.
steps.description: You need to know whether you are measuring chair covers for only one corner piece or an entire room.

steps.headline: Determine what type of furniture covers you want.
steps.description: Know what style and pattern you want to emulate so you know where to purchase the covers. You may also want to set an expected budget since some materials are more expensive than others.

steps.headline: Use a tape measure, and measure the top of the first chair's back.
steps.description: Extend the tape measure to the ground. This number is considered the height of the chair.

steps.headline: Measure the distance from 1 end of the widest part of the back to the other.
steps.description: This measurement is the chair's width.

steps.headline: Record the chair's depth.
steps.description: Run your tape measure from the chair's backrest to the front of the seat.

steps.headline: Determine the leg spread or leg width of the chair.
steps.description: Measure the distance from 1 of the back leg rests to the other.

steps.headline: Compare your measurements to ready-made chair cover options available.
steps.description: You can visit many home-decorating stores in-person or shop online to find the covers that best suit your needs. If you cannot locate covers that fulfill your sizing requirements, you can have the covers custom-made by a local tailor or online supply company.

steps.headline: Purchase the chair covers, and follow the manufacturer's instructions for installing them on your chairs.

text: Identify what chairs you want to wrap. You need to know whether you are measuring chair covers for only one corner piece or an entire room. Determine what type of furniture covers you want. Know what style and pattern you want to emulate so you know where to purchase the covers. You may also want to set an expected budget since some materials are more expensive than others. Use a tape measure, and measure the top of the first chair's back. Extend the tape measure to the ground. This number is considered the height of the chair. Measure the distance from 1 end of the widest part of the back to the other. This measurement is the chair's width. Record the chair's depth. Run your tape measure from the chair's backrest to the front of the seat. Determine the leg spread or leg width of the chair. Measure the distance from 1 of the back leg rests to the other. Compare your measurements to ready-made chair cover options available. You can visit many home-decorating stores in-person or shop online to find the covers that best suit your needs. If you cannot locate covers that fulfill your sizing requirements, you can have the covers custom-made by a local tailor or online supply company. Purchase the chair covers, and follow the manufacturer's instructions for installing them on your chairs.
